page.title: 07LONGNOR HALL
page.content: Longnor Hall-which featured in the first{D.S.}has been in the possession of the{Burton}family since l340.In that time the Hall has been rebuilt several times,the latest being an example of{John Nash}work.The estate has a tradition that it can only be handed down intact to each eldest son. The estate runs to about 2000 acres, half of which is farmed,the rest let to tenants.The garden contains an interesting tomb.The incumbent Burton at the time of Henry VIII became a Protestant with his king. Under Mary Tudor he refused to become a Catholic and was in danger of death. At the time of her death his sons brought the news from S'bury,the shock killed him.Refused an R.C. funeral he was entombed on his own lawn with an appropriate anti-papist slogan!
